clinical_study.brief_title: A Prospective Randomized Comparison of Fentanyl, Methadone and Morphine for Epidural Analgesia in an Experimental Pain Model
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Randomized Comparison of Fentanyl, Methadone and Morphine for Epidural Analgesia in an Experimental Pain Model

brief_summary.textblock: The aims of this study are to provide pharmacokinetic-pharmacodynamic data to quantify the analgesic and side effect profiles of epidural methadone, fentanyl and morphine. The investigators will compare the analgesic effect at three dermatomes to assess the rostral spread of drug, the investigators will assess plasma levels to assess the systemic redistribution of drug and the investigators will assess surrogate markers of central opiate effects (nasal capnography and pupilometry). The investigators hypothesize that due to the long-duration of action of methadone, and its intermediate lipophilicity, that methadone will provide a predominantly segmental analgesia of long duration of action, with low rostral spread and low direct central depressant effects (including respiratory depression).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in heat pain tolerance from baseline (using QST Medoc)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At intervals: 30, 60, 90, 120, 180, 240, 300, 360, 410 min following drug and 24 hours following drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in electrical pain tolerance from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At same time intervals as primary outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of methadone, fentanyl, morphine (and metabolites)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At each of the time intervals as for primary endpoint
At each of the time intervals as primary endpoint

secondary_outcome.measure: Respiratory rate and arterial CO2 tension
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At each of the time intervals as primary endpoint

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients (men and women) scheduled for extracorporeal shock wave lithotrypsy (for nephrolithiasis) under regional anesthesia.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to understand consent form; poor communication Refusal to sign consent form Contraindication to regional anesthesia Chronic opioid administration ASA classification 3 or greater Age < 18 or > 70
